p: Furthermore, many dietary supplements do not contain the nutrients they claim. For example, the content of ephedra alkaloids in herbal dietary supplements containing ephedra was assayed in one study ( Gurley et al., 2000 ). Assays of 20 ephedra-containing dietary supplements showed that alkaloid content differed substantially from label claims in more than 50 % of the products and in some cases were inconsistent between two batches of the same product. One product contained no ephedra alkaloids at all, whereas others had contents varying by more than 20 % of those indicated on the label.
